  17. (******************************* Breakpoints ***************************)

  19. open Checkpoints
  20. open Debugcom
  21. open Instruct
  22. open Events
  23. open Printf

  25. (*** Debugging. ***)
  26. ‌let debug_breakpoints = ref false

  28. (*** Data. ***)

  30. (* Number of the last added breakpoint. *)
  31. ‌let breakpoint_number = ref 0

  33. (* Breakpoint number -> event. *)
  34. ‌type breakpoint_id = int
  35. ‌let breakpoints = ref ([] : (breakpoint_id * code_event) list)

  37. (* Program counter -> breakpoint count. *)
  38. ‌let positions = ref ([] : (pc * int ref) list)

  40. (* Versions of the breakpoint list. *)
  41. ‌let current_version = ref 0
  42. ‌let max_version = ref 0

  44. (*** Miscellaneous. ***)

  46. (* Mark breakpoints as installed in current checkpoint. *)
  47. ‌let copy_breakpoints () =
  48.   !current_checkpoint.c_breakpoints <- !positions;
  49.   !current_checkpoint.c_breakpoint_version <- !current_version

  51. (* Announce a new version of the breakpoint list. *)
  52. ‌let new_version () =
  53.   incr max_version;
  54.   current_version := !max_version

  56. (*** Information about breakpoints. ***)

  58. ‌let breakpoints_count () =
  59.   List.length !breakpoints

  61. (* List of breakpoints at `pc'. *)
  62. ‌let rec breakpoints_at_pc pc =
  63.   begin match Symbols.event_at_pc pc with
  64.   | {ev_frag = frag; ev_ev = {ev_repr = Event_child {contents = pos}}} ->
  65.      breakpoints_at_pc {frag; pos}
  66.   | _ -> []
  67.   | exception Not_found -> []
  68.   end
  69.     @
  70.   List.map fst (List.filter
  71.                   (function (_, {ev_frag = frag; ev_ev = {ev_pos = pos}}) ->
  72.                             {frag; pos} = pc)
  73.                   !breakpoints)

  75. (* Is there a breakpoint at `pc' ? *)
  76. let breakpoint_at_pc pc =
  77.   breakpoints_at_pc pc <> []

  79. (*** Set and remove breakpoints ***)

  81. let print_pc out {frag;pos} = fprintf out "%d:%d" frag pos

  83. (* Remove all breakpoints. *)
  84. let remove_breakpoints pcs =
  85.   if !debug_breakpoints then
  86.     printf "Removing breakpoints...\n%!";
  87.   List.iter
  88.     (function (pc, _) ->
  89.        if !debug_breakpoints then printf "%a\n%!" print_pc pc;
  90.        reset_instr pc;
  91.        Symbols.set_event_at_pc pc)
  92.     pcs

  94. (* Set all breakpoints. *)
  95. ‌let set_breakpoints pcs =
  96.   if !debug_breakpoints then
  97.     printf "Setting breakpoints...\n%!";
  98.   List.iter
  99.     (function (pc, _) ->
  100.        if !debug_breakpoints then printf "%a\n%!" print_pc pc;
  101.        set_breakpoint pc)
  102.     pcs

  104. (* Ensure the current version is installed in current checkpoint. *)
  105. ‌let update_breakpoints () =
  106.   if !debug_breakpoints then begin
  107.     prerr_string "Updating breakpoints... ";
  108.     prerr_int !current_checkpoint.c_breakpoint_version;
  109.     prerr_string " ";
  110.     prerr_int !current_version;
  111.     prerr_endline ""
  112.   end;
  113.   if !current_checkpoint.c_breakpoint_version <> !current_version then
  114.     Exec.protect
  115.       (function () ->
  116.          remove_breakpoints !current_checkpoint.c_breakpoints;
  117.          set_breakpoints !positions;
  118.          copy_breakpoints ())

  120. (* Execute given function with no breakpoint in current checkpoint. *)
  121. (* --- `goto' runs faster this way (does not stop on each breakpoint). *)
  122. let execute_without_breakpoints f =
  123.   Misc.protect_refs [Misc.R (Debugger_config.break_on_load, false);
  124.                      Misc.R (current_version, 0);
  125.                      Misc.R (positions, []);
  126.                      Misc.R (breakpoints, []);
  127.                      Misc.R (breakpoint_number, 0)]
  128.                     f

  130. (* Add a position in the position list. *)
  131. (* Change version if necessary. *)
  132. let insert_position pos =
  133.   try
  134.     incr (List.assoc pos !positions)
  135.   with
  136.     Not_found ->
  137.       positions := (pos, ref 1) :: !positions;
  138.       new_version ()

  140. (* Remove a position in the position list. *)
  141. (* Change version if necessary. *)
  142. ‌let remove_position pos =
  143.   let count = List.assoc pos !positions in
  144.     decr count;
  145.     if !count = 0 then begin
  146.       positions := List.remove_assoc pos !positions;
  147.       new_version ()
  148.     end

  150. (* Insert a new breakpoint in lists. *)
  151. let rec new_breakpoint event =
  152.   match event with
  153.     {ev_frag=frag; ev_ev={ev_repr=Event_child pos}} ->
  154.       new_breakpoint (Symbols.any_event_at_pc {frag; pos=(!pos)})
  155.   | {ev_frag=frag; ev_ev={ev_pos=pos}} ->
  156.     let pc = {frag; pos} in
  157.     Exec.protect
  158.       (function () ->
  159.          incr breakpoint_number;
  160.          insert_position pc;
  161.          breakpoints := (!breakpoint_number, event) :: !breakpoints);
  162.     if !Parameters.breakpoint then
  163.       printf "Breakpoint %d at %a: %s\n%!" !breakpoint_number print_pc pc
  164.              (Pos.get_desc event)

  166. (* Remove a breakpoint from lists. *)
  167. let remove_breakpoint number =
  168.   try
  169.     let ev = List.assoc number !breakpoints in
  170.     let pc = {frag = ev.ev_frag; pos=ev.ev_ev.ev_pos} in
  171.     Exec.protect
  172.       (function () ->
  173.          breakpoints := List.remove_assoc number !breakpoints;
  174.          remove_position pc;
  175.          if !Parameters.breakpoint then
  176.            printf "Removed breakpoint %d at %a: %s\n%!" number print_pc pc
  177.                   (Pos.get_desc ev))
  178.   with
  179.     Not_found ->
  180.       prerr_endline ("No breakpoint number " ^ (Int.to_string number) ^ ".");
  181.       raise Not_found

  183. ‌let remove_all_breakpoints () =
  184.   List.iter (function (number, _) -> remove_breakpoint number) !breakpoints

  186. (*** Temporary breakpoints. ***)

  188. (* Temporary breakpoint position. *)
  189. let temporary_breakpoint_position = ref (None : pc option)

  191. (* Execute `funct' with a breakpoint added at `pc'. *)
  192. (* --- Used by `finish'. *)
  193. let exec_with_temporary_breakpoint pc funct =
  194.   let previous_version = !current_version in
  195. ‌    let remove () =
  196.       temporary_breakpoint_position := None;
  197.       current_version := previous_version;
  198.       let count = List.assoc pc !positions in
  199.         decr count;
  200.         if !count = 0 then begin
  201.           positions := List.remove_assoc pc !positions;
  202.           reset_instr pc;
  203.           Symbols.set_event_at_pc pc
  204.         end

  206.     in
  207.       Exec.protect (function () -> insert_position pc);
  208.       temporary_breakpoint_position := Some pc;
  209.       Fun.protect ~finally:(fun () -> Exec.protect remove) funct
